Issues.Title: Is this the stable version of tailwind v4?
Issues.Body:
Very good project, I am using it very well, thank you very much

I tried applying it to Spring Boot and NextJS, but there are too many parts that don't apply. It's burdensome to upgrade.

Even if you change the existing class, there are many cases where the classes in the official document are not applied.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Is this the stable version of tailwind v4?" (#16483)

Issues.Title: Simple peer-checked usage not working after v4
Issues.Body:
I have a "concealed radio button" component in my codebase that looks like: ```
``` The `peer-checked` classes are applied 100% of the time, rather than only when the peer input is checked. This usage seems consistent with [the docs](https://tailwindcss.com/docs/hover-focus-and-other-states#styling-based-on-sibling-state), does not seem to be related to the more complex use that was causing a problem in [this issue](https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/discussions/13626) and `peer` isn't mentioned in [this upgrade guide](https://tailwindcss.com/docs/upgrade-guide). Was working as expected before our v4 upgrade. What am I doing wrong?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Simple peer-checked usage not working after v4" (#16479)

Issues.Title: Missing @property for --tw-drop-shadow
Issues.Body:
When using a [filter](https://tailwindcss.com/docs/filter) utility, variables get declared via `@property` for all filter effects except for `drop-shadow`. It probably needs to be added to [this list](https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/blame/c80c0b5128f4997154ef58f062702306b5f8e608/packages/tailwindcss/src/utilities.ts#L3144).

I also noticed that `backdrop-filter` is missing the corresponding `drop-shadow` utility but I couldn't get the effect to work with vanilla CSS so I guess it doesn't have any practical effect and this would explain why it was omitted.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Missing @property for --tw-drop-shadow" (#16461)

Issues.Title: Emit `--tw-drop-shadow` property
Issues.Body:
Fixes #16461 Ensure we also emit `@property --tw-drop-shadow`. ## Test plan ```
``` now only drops one shadow (screenshot from Vite playground):
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Emit `--tw-drop-shadow` property" (#16471)

Issues.Title: Read from `--default-outline-width`
Issues.Body:
Closes https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss.com/issues/2073

This ensures that we can customize `outline` via `--default-outline-width` just like `ring`, `border`, and other utilities. 

## Test plan

Added unit tests for `--default-outline-width` and `--default-ring-width`
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Read from `--default-outline-width`" (#16469)

Issues.Title: [v4] bg-gradient "via-*" regression
Issues.Body:
The `via-*` doesn't behave exactly the same in v4 compared to v3.

In v3 the `via-*` would not apply in dark mode unless explicitly defined with `dark:via-*` 

See reproduction below (use dark mode):

v3: https://play.tailwindcss.com/AMQVQTde5u
v4: https://play.tailwindcss.com/yjYWAUQBCw

Same code in both playground, but result's different
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[v4] bg-gradient "via-*" regression" (#16474)

Issues.Title: [v4] Jest/React Testing Library stopped detecting styling via classes after upgrading from v3
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

v4.0.6

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

Jest 29.7.0
@testing-library/react 16.0.0
jest-environment-jsdom
happy-dom

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

22.13.1

**What operating system are you using?**

macOS

**Describe your issue**

I have an issue with detecting styling with RTL after upgrading to v4, looks like RTL has issues with picking up styles from Tailwind classes. When using helpers such as `toHaveStyle` or `toBeVisible`, it appears that components are not styled at all:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/200c6256-cb3a-4a56-8293-8c8e4f9a3432)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/74b476aa-05ef-4c6d-86bf-5aed838dc49b)

I tried a couple of test environments for Jest and none of them worked -- when using `jest-environment-jsdom` there is an accompanying error `Error: Could not parse CSS stylesheet`, with `happy-dom` there's no such error, but the tests that involve styling checks still don't pass.

To set up components for tests, I use the following config that injects CSS output file created via `npx @tailwindcss/cli`, it worked completely fine on v3:
```js
export const render = (
  ui,
  {
    store = createTestStore(),
    route = '/',
    history = defaultHistory,
    customRouter = false,
    deviceWidth = 1024,
    ...renderOptions
  } = {},
) => {
  const Wrapper = ({ children }) =>
    wrapTestRender(children, { store, history, deviceWidth, customRouter })

  if (!customRouter) {
    history.replace(route)
  }

  const view = rtlRender(ui, { wrapper: Wrapper, ...renderOptions })

  const style = document.createElement('style')
  style.innerHTML = fs.readFileSync(
    'app/globalStyles/tailwind-output.css',
    'utf8',
  )
  document.head.appendChild(style)

  return view
}
```

Has anybody successfully set up Jest/RTL after migrating to v4? Thanks!
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[v4] Jest/React Testing Library stopped detecting styling via classes after upgrading from v3" (#16440)

Issues.Title: Tailwind CLI doesn't minify properly using another lib on top
Issues.Body:
### Description

First of all, thanks for all your work. Tailwind nowadays is like a piece of art to me.

The problem is using daisyui css (v5) (that contains all the tailwindcss layers and stuff), I created a sample file and configuration to test the behaviour. In this case, the expected behaviour is that all the layers and css clases were removed to have a minimum-sized css file.

When I launch the command, I received a css file of +800kb. I know that it seems to be a daisyui problem but the responsability of minifying is in tailwind.

I tried to define the base of source files in order to avoid that tailwind use the "daisyui source" and define all the classes

### Tailwindcss Version
v4.0.6

### File tree tested

* config/
    *  app.css
* static/
    * css/
        * daisyui.css
* test_folder/
    * test.html

### Command used

`DEBUG=1 tailwindcss -i config/app.css -o static/tailwind.css -m`

### Content of app.css
```css
@import "tailwindcss" source("../test_folder");
@import "../static/css/daisyui.css";
```

### Content of test.html
```html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <title>Title</title>
    <link href="/static/tailwind.css" rel="stylesheet">
</head>
<body>
    <button class="btn btn-primary">Test</button>
</body>
</html>
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Tailwind CLI doesn't minify properly using another lib on top" (#16453)

Issues.Body: margin-bottom & margin-top does not apply on elements that are inline by default ! for example if i want to give margin-bottom to a label I should manually make the element inline-block or block !!!
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "margin-bottom & margin-top does not apply!" (#16450)

Issues.Title: Please give me details related to our code for "Unknown word" error.
Issues.Body:
After upgrading to Tailwind 4, I'm getting this error in my Qwik + Tailwind app:

```
x Build failed in 4.66s
error during build:
[vite:css] [postcss] /Project/SiteQwik/src/global.css:3444:27: Unknown word
file: /Project/SiteQwik/src/global.css:3444:26
    at Input.error (/npm/node_modules/postcss/lib/input.js:109:16)
    at Parser.unknownWord (/npm/node_modules/postcss/lib/parser.js:593:22)
    at Parser.other (/npm/node_modules/postcss/lib/parser.js:435:12)
    at Parser.parse (/npm/node_modules/postcss/lib/parser.js:470:16)
    at parse (/npm/node_modules/postcss/lib/parse.js:11:12)
    at new LazyResult (/npm/node_modules/postcss/lib/lazy-result.js:133:16)
    at Processor.process (/npm/node_modules/postcss/lib/processor.js:53:14)
    at compileCSS (file:///npm/node_modules/vite/dist/node/chunks/dep-CHZK6zbr.js:36898:59)
    at async Object.transform (file:///npm/node_modules/vite/dist/node/chunks/dep-CHZK6zbr.js:36171:11)
    at async transform (file:///npm/node_modules/rollup/dist/es/shared/node-entry.js:20698:16)

❌ Error: Client build failed: Error: Command failed with exit code 1: npm run build.client

node:internal/modules/cjs/loader:1247
  throw err;
```

The problem is that it does not tell us where. As a developer I need to know some info related to **MY** code in order to be able to track the problem and solve it.

Please give us some info related to our code in this error.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Please give me details related to our code for "Unknown word" error." (#16447)

Issues.Title: Don’t replace `_` in suggested theme keys
Issues.Body:
Fixes https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss-intellisense/issues/1184

The alpha and beta releases used `_` in theme keys to represent a `.`. This meant we used `--leading-1_5` instead of `--leading-1\.5` to add utilities like `leading-1.5`. We prefer the use of the escaped dot now but still want to make sure suggestions for the legacy key format still works as expected when surrounded by numbers.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Don’t replace `_` in suggested theme keys" (#16433)

Issues.Title: [v4] @apply rule doesn't seem to be working. Please, help to investigate
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

v4.0.0 (with the upgrade package)

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

Next.js 15.1.5

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

v22.13.1

**What browser are you using?**

Irrelevant

**What operating system are you using?**

Irrelevant

**Reproduction URL**

Since the project I work on is open-sourced, please take a look at the branch I've created https://github.com/finom/vovk-examples/tree/tailwind-bug
/src/app/globals.css is quite minimal, I hope it's OK

**Describe your issue**

I've upgraded to the version v4 and my global styles at /src/app/globals.css aren't applied to the body tag.

I tried two ways to do that. With @layer

```css
@import 'tailwindcss';
@layer base {
    body {
        @apply bg-slate-50 dark:bg-[#0d1117f7];
    }
}
```

and without @layer 

```css
@import 'tailwindcss';
body {
    @apply bg-slate-50 dark:bg-[#0d1117f7];
}
```
Neither of these are working

If I add a normal CSS property

```css
@import 'tailwindcss';
body {
    @apply bg-slate-50 dark:bg-[#0d1117f7];
    background: red;
}
```

It works.

The CSS file is imported from src/app/layout.tsx  like this


```ts
import './globals.css';
```

I think I misconfigured TW but I don't know what exactly did I do wrong. Thank you for your help.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[v4] @apply rule doesn't seem to be working. Please, help to investigate" (#16428)

Issues.Title: Vite: Add option to disable module-graph based scanning
Issues.Body:
This PR adds an option to the Vite plugin to control wether or not the module-graph based dependency scanner is used. 

The main motivation for doing this is a number of SSR specific build issues where differences in the dependency graphs for SSR and client builds would cause unexpected production builds. Some specific examples:

- #16389
- #16252
- #15794

The new option has a way to force `module-graph` and `file-system` based candidate scanning but will default to an `automatic` mode that will detect Astro and change the default behavior there to immediately fix the most prominent issue (#15794). 

It is configured like this:

```js
import { defineConfig } from 'vite'
import tailwindcss from '@tailwindcss/vite'

export default defineConfig({
  plugins: [tailwindcss({ scanner: 'file-system' })],
})
```

## Test plan

- I updated the Astro integration test to include an example using the `client:only` directive that was able to reproduce the issue #15794
- I also added an example that was able to reproduce the issue with React Router as outlined in #16252
- The existing SSR tests were also able to reproduce the issues form #16389 by having both entry points use different class names.

I ensured that the new option turns-on automatically for Astro and that enabling it manually fixes the other cases.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Vite: Add option to disable module-graph based scanning " (#16425)
